Abstract: This dataset represents the points representing center locations of universities in Washington, DC 2006

    <descript>
      <abstract>This dataset represents the points representing center locations of universities in Washington, DC 2006</abstract>
      <purpose>This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.</purpose>
    </descript>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the cd obtained from Washington, DC 2005

Universities were identified from public records, their websites, and maps (ADC Washington DC Atlas). A centroid for each university campus was heads-up digitized from the 1995 orthophotographs. Attribute data was provided by university websites. The square suffix lot attribute (if appropriate) was generated through comparison of the university with GIS data from the DC Office of Tax and Revenue. Planimetrics were created at a scale of 1:1,000. This means that a well defined feature falls within two feet of true position.

All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2001</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer</cntorg>
              <cntper>GIS Data Coordinator</cntper>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>
              <address>441 4th St NW, Suite 930 South</address>
              <city>Washington</city>
              <state>DC</state>
              <postal>20001</postal>
              <country>USA</country>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
            <cntfax>(202) 727-5660</cntfax>
            <cntemail>dcgis@dc.gov</cntemail>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Using information from various sources and websites, staff updated the list of universities.  Field research was used to supplement and clarify source information.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2005</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Office of the Chief Technology Officer</cntorg>
              <cntper>GIS Data Coordinator</cntper>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>
              <address>441 4th st NW, Suite 930 South</address>
              <city>Washington</city>
              <state>DC</state>
              <postal>20001</postal>
              <country>USA</country>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice/>
            <cntfax>202-727-5660</cntfax>
            <cntemail>dcgis@dc.gov</cntemail>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>* Extended length of NAME fied to 75 from 50 
* Reviewed Names of Schools (spellling etc)
* Standardized name to 'George Washington University at Mount Vernon College' (both Pt and Ply)
* Made sure number of records in UniversPt = UnivesityPly
* Updated GWU & Georgetown polygons
* Added over a a dozen new universities to the file</procdesc>
        <procdate>2006</procdate>
      </procstep>
